alert.note: Alert for Erie; Wyoming (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 17 at 2:55PM EST until February 18 at 1:00PM EST by NWS Buffalo
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in New York... Cayuga Creek Near Lancaster affecting Wyoming and Erie Counties. .The following flood warnings are for high flows from rain and snowmelt. Potential ice jams through tonight may result in more significant flooding localized near ice jams. For the Cayuga Creek...including Lancaster...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON TO EARLY FRIDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Cayuga Creek Near Lancaster. * WHEN...From this afternoon to early Friday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 8.0 feet, Flood stage, minor flooding in low lying areas of Lancaster and Alden. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:30 PM EST Thursday the stage was 8.1 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 2:30 PM EST Thursday was 8.1 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise to 8.3 feet just after midnight tonight. It will fall below flood stage Friday morning. - Flood stage is 8.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 8.3 feet on 01/25/2010. - For more information please visit http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 300 AM EST.
